attributes.action: Provide financial support to the hospitality industry during the Omicron wave
attributes.additional_details:
The hospitality industry employs nearly 3 million people, almost 10% of the British workforce. It is the third biggest employer in the UK, making up 6% of businesses and 5% of GDP.

It has already been devastated by the pandemic, with revenue at 70% of normal even outside of lockdown, and huge problems with staffing. Many made it through thanks to furlough payments, loans and grants only by a hair’s breadth. 

Because the Government has not mandated closures, they have zero support. Help them.
attributes.background: England has decided not to mandate closures for hospitality venues, such as restaurants, bars, pubs, hotels, & nightclubs. However, the British public are following scientific advice & cancelling plans anyway. The industry needs support: bring back furlough & grants immediately for Christmas.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/603456
